Articles.Content: Does anyone know if FAR is working currently?
I can confirm both the perfectrons and the L.E.S. pack are working correctly.
I can confirm the M22 parts are working. I've been testing them

Enhanced Navball looks ok.

Edit:

Tac Fuel Balancer

Tac Part Lister

Chaterrer

All seem ok.

Edited April 2, 2014 by Cpt. Kipard

Has anyone tested Kerbal Alarm Clock with 0.23.5 yet?

If not, will do so when I get home from work.
I can confirm that TextureReplacer is working just fine.

Which of those docking mods is this one?

I don't know, but a quick test seems to show the one in your link working.

I don't know, but a quick test seems to show the one in your link working.

Wonderful, its my favorite docking assistant
Notes, Alarm Clock and Alternate Resource Panel seem to be working.

I've only had a little time to test, but all of my mods seem to be working fine: TAC Life Support, TAC Fuel Balancer, TAC Part Lister, TAC Atomic Clock, TAC Self Destruct. Links are in my sig. (Not the Smaller SAS Parts. That was abandoned.)

There is one caveat for TAC Life Support: be careful using time warp in the Space Center and Tracking Station scenes. There is no Monitoring Window to alert you that a ship is running low on supplies and it will not stop time warp when supplies become low or run out.

Chatterer is mostly working, but there are some issues.

RCS Sounds seems ok.

Edited April 2, 2014 by razark
seems like most of the mods thats not working right have some intergration into tracking center or when at space center screen
How is FAR doing @ferram4?
Anyone tested with B9 + fixes from .23?

Novapunch is fine; the 3.75m parts all play nicely together, and the NP engines are actually a little more "hardcore" than the new stock ones, tuning wise, while the tanks should be completely interchangeable.

Tiberdyne Shuttle System should be working as well as it was in 0.23.0 - and the joint tweaks should benefit both mods rather nicely, so more stability ftw.

Except small updates for both to fix any nagging issues at some point in the short term (hopefully)

(edit: links in my signature below)

Edited April 2, 2014 by Tiberion

I made a backup of my career mode save and played around in it for about an hour and didn't notice any issues with the mods I have installed (I'm only listing the ones not already mentioned as working on the first post):

Deadly Reentry Continued

Ferram Aerospace Research

TAC Fuel Balancer

Editor Extensions

Vessel Orbital Information Display (VOID)

Remote Tech 2 is listed as not working, but I didn't have any problems with it.
Final Frontier works for me.
I did some testing of the "GHud" mod and verified it working throughout launch and around 4 planets. You can put it in the likely working column.

I've tested these in a new career mode save for about an hour with no problems:

PreciseNode

Final Frontier

You can put them in the likely working column.
Extraplanetary Launchpads just updated to 4.1 with 23.5 compatibility: http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/59545-0-23-5-Extraplanetary-Launchpads-v4-1?p=1058302&viewfull=1#post1058302
Kerbal Attachment System seems to work. I've only done limited testing though.
I think Infernal Robotics has more than just GUI problems. It's not working at all for me. You can see the interface in the VAB, but not in flight, and nothing moves even if I set hotkeys.
RSS, RF, RO, and DREC all seem fine. RF doesn't support the new parts yet.

SDHI Service Module System confirmed compatible with 0.23.5 ARM update.

However, using the SMS with the stock/NASA Kerbodyne LES during pad aborts will result in very rough landings, as the Kerbodyne LES can't lift the pod high enough (first stage aborts are okay).

I've tested these in a new career mode save for about an hour with no problems:

PreciseNode

PreciseNode has a problem when opening the maneuver node gizmo (default key: O).
